title: Champagne Glass Modeling and Simulation
text: champagneJOLIVEI8 package provides functions modeling volume champagne glass based height radius. includes non-vectorized vectorized versions modeling function. Additionally, package offers simulation function estimate amount champagne needed party based number guests, glasses per guest, pouring intervals.

title: Champagne Glass Modeling and Simulation
text: can install package GitHub using devtools package:

title: Champagne Glass Modeling and Simulation
text: function going use following variables: - h: Height champagne glass. - r: Radius champagne glass. However, vectorized functions going variables vectors: - heights: Numeric vector heights. - radii: Numeric vector radii.

title: Champagne Glass Modeling and Simulation
text: ‚Äôs quick example use champagneJOLIVEI8 package:
code: library(champagneJOLIVEI8)  # Example data heights <- c(2, 3, 4) radii <- c(1, 2, 3)  # Calculate the volume of a champagne glass champagne_glass(2, 1)  # Vectorized version using a for loop vectorized_for_loop(heights, radii)  # Vectorized version using purrr map function vectorized_purrr_map(heights, radii)  # Vectorized version using apply functions vectorized_sapply(heights, radii)  # Vectorize Function vectorize_function(heights, radii)

title: Champagne Glass Modeling and Simulation
text: solutions homework divided two main parts: - Part 1: part1_modeling.Rmd find answers first part regarding Champagne glass problem. can directly run file. (can find repository : https://github.com/ptds2023/homework-4-jolivei8) Part 2: parts related R package. create website locally pkgdown, can run following command R console (make sure already installed pkgdown package):

title: Champagne Glass Modeling and Simulation
text: files provides modeling approach champagne glass, comparing various implementations efficiency. includes vectorized version benchmarks using microbenchmark. Additionally, document covers volume computations, party organization simulations, estimating bottle requirements 99% satisfaction rate. ) Modeling Champagne Glass - Implementation Comparison: Several approaches (loop, purrr map, apply functions) benchmarked vectorized version. - Vectorized Version: concise vectorized implementation proposed benchmarked. b) Computing Volume Champagne Glass - Integration Techniques: volume computed using integration techniques given function. c) Organizing Champagne Party - Simulation: 10,000 parties simulated, recording total liters bottles served. - Visualizations: Boxplots histograms visualize distribution servings. - Quantile Calculation: number bottles needed 99% satisfaction rate estimated.

title: Champagne Glass Modeling and Simulation
text: objectives homework assignment follows: üìè Develop deep understanding mathematical modeling calculus R, particularly focusing disk integration method calculating volumes. üñ•Ô∏è Enhance skills vectorized computations R, comparing different approaches performance optimization. üß™ Strengthen understanding statistical distributions application simulations, Poisson Normal distributions. üíª Master use R programming tools like integrate, uniroot, optimize, various functions purrr package. üì¶ Develop competency R package development, including function documentation, testing, version control GitHub.

title: Champagne Glass Modeling and Simulation
text: problem, simply wrap functions Part package: Create package champagneUSERNAME (USERNAME GitHub username without special characters) RStudio: File -> New Project‚Ä¶ -> New Directory -> R Package. Create new GitHub repo champagneUSERNAME (USERNAME GitHub username without special characters) ptds2023 organization synchronize ‚Äúinitial‚Äù package. Copy functions previous problem R/ folder. Commit. Document functions using roxygen2 comments. Use devtools::document() generate help files afterwards. forget specify @export roxygen2 comments export functions NAMESPACE (make visible outside package). Commit. least following tags: Fill DESCRIPTION file much possible. Commit. Clean auto-generated file hello.R hello.Rd, R/ man/, respectively. Commit. Remove NAMESPACE file, since auto-generated roxygen2 (, therefore, prevents roxygen2 overwrite NAMESPACE). , evoke command devtools::document() generate . Commit. end step, please, forget commit meaningful message. Note use packages, specify DESCRIPTION file Imports section. use function package specify namespace. , use pkg::function() function. step, verify everything works well. need Install Restart (Build tab) try run f() (may name differently), well look help file ?f. Add automatic tests testthat. least one test per function. example, make sure obtain given error ‚Äúwrong‚Äù input provided. least use test performed previous part exercise. Correct every errors, warnings notes obtained devtools::check() (equivalently clicking Check). Add Github action make automatic checks least Windows, MAC Ubuntu OS. Create website pkgdown. Build create Github action.
